summary.para: The CMSG_RC2_AUX_INFO structure contains the bit length of the key for RC2 encryption algorithms. The pvEncryptionAuxInfo member in can be set to point to an instance of this structure. Note This structure is only used when the other members of a structure indicate that a default key length of 40 bits is to be used with an RC2 encryption algorithm. For more information, see CMSG_ENVELOPED_ENCODE_INFO.
Size of this structure in bytes.
Specifies the RC2 effective key length. Currently 40-, 64-, and 128-bit lengths are supported.

Note This value is the actual key bit length to be used. The values of the dwVersion member of a structure to indicate the use of a specific key length is not that specific key length. For example, the dwVersion value that indicates the use of a 128-bit key length is CRYPT_RC2_128BIT_VERSION, which is defined as 58, not 128 bits.
Note If dwBitLen is set to CMSG_SP3_COMPATIBLE_ENCRYPT_FLAG, SP3 compatible encryption is done and the 40-bit default length is ignored.
